name: io.github.redis/mcp-redis
description: The official Redis MCP Server is a natural language interface designed for agentic applications to manage and search data in Redis efficiently

tools.name: string
tools.description: Tools to set, get strings with expiration. Useful for storing simple configuration values, session data, or caching responses.

tools.name: hash
tools.description: Tools to store field-value pairs within a single key. The hash can store vector embeddings. Useful for representing objects with multiple attributes, user profiles, or product information where fields can be accessed individually.

tools.name: list
tools.description: Tools with common operations to append and pop items. Useful for queues, message brokers, or maintaining a list of most recent actions.

tools.name: set
tools.description: Tools to add, remove and list set members. Useful for tracking unique values like user IDs or tags, and for performing set operations like intersection.

tools.name: sorted set
tools.description: Tools to manage data for e.g. leaderboards, priority queues, or time-based analytics with score-based ordering.

tools.name: pub/sub
tools.description: Functionality to publish messages to channels and subscribe to receive them. Useful for real-time notifications, chat applications, or distributing updates to multiple clients.

tools.name: streams
tools.description: Tools to add, read, and delete from data streams. Useful for event sourcing, activity feeds, or sensor data logging with consumer groups support.

tools.name: JSON
tools.description: Tools to store, retrieve, and manipulate JSON documents in Redis. Useful for complex nested data structures, document databases, or configuration management with path-based access.

tools.name: query engine
tools.description: Tools to manage vector indexes and perform vector search

tools.name: server management
tools.description: Tool to retrieve information about the database
